summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling a remote arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell on July 14, 2020. It details the procedures for public and press audio/video access, including special provisions for alleged victims and the defendant's family, while addressing COVID-19 safety protocols.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) for whom the arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing are being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, setting the hearing date and access procedures for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Remote Arraignment, Initial Conference, and Bail Hearing
events.description: A combined remote video/teleconference hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment, initial conference, and bail determination.

events.title: Previous Court Order Issued
events.description: The court issued a previous order (Dkt. No. 10) referenced in this document regarding courthouse access.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: A remote video/teleconference hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing is scheduled for July 14, 2020, at 1 pm.
The court order provides specific phone numbers and access codes (855-268-7844, access code 32091812#, PIN 9921299#) for the public and press to listen to the live audio feed.
Special provisions are made for alleged victims, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771(a)(4), to be heard at the bail hearing, requiring the U.S. Attorney's Office to notify the court.

Due to COVID-19, in-person viewing of the video feed at the courthouse is limited to approximately 60 seats with social distancing, and the court may switch to audio-only access if public health conditions change.
The order strictly prohibits photographing, recording, or rebroadcasting the proceedings, with potential fines or sanctions for violations.
